snippet: Apple’s MobileMe service is scheduled to end on June 30. Here are possible replacements for its photo/video galleries, Web page building tools and online hard drives.
Technology is supposed to make life easier, but it often comes with layers of jargon, settings and hardware adjustments. Here are answers to some tech questions.
abstract: Sam Grobart Tool Kit column contends that although technology is supposed to make life easier, it often comes with layers of jargon, settings and hardware adjustments; presents answers to some tech questions.

headline.main: The Technology in Our Lives, and How to Make It Work Better
headline.print_headline: The Technology in Our Lives, And How to Make It Work Better

snippet: In an age of e-communications, publishers and writers hope the personal touch possible at BookExpo America will help sell books.
abstract: Authors and publishers mingle with librarians and book sellers at the annual trade convention BookExpo America, hoping that personal interactions will create underground excitement for their books even as they predict the demise of their industry.

headline.main: Expo’s Hope: Personal Touch to Sell Books
headline.print_headline: Expo’s Hope: Personal Touch To Sell Books

snippet: As smartphones have reached only 20 percent of the developing world, Facebook needs to get into the phone business because it could reach an audience that can't afford today's smartphones or the monthly data and voice costs that come with them. It...
abstract: As smartphones have reached only 20 percent of the developing world, Facebook needs to get into the phone business because it could reach an audience that can't afford today's smartphones or the monthly data and voice costs that come with them. It's the same market it wants to reach with its basic Web-based service.

headline.main: Why Facebook Should Build a Phone

snippet: A columnist offers suggestions on how to improve the chaotic app-buying process.
abstract: Bob Tedeschi App Smart column offers suggestions on how to improve the chaotic app-buying process.

headline.main: Some Final Thoughts on a Booming Industry
headline.print_headline: Some Final Thoughts on a Booming Industry

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Wednesday's selection includes an explanation of the dreaded vertical video syndrome, Tony Fadel on creativity and a discussion on why there...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Wednesday's selection includes an explanation of the dreaded vertical video syndrome, Tony Fadel on creativity and a discussion on why there are not more technology start-ups in developing countries.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot:  Prospectus Humor and 3rd World Start-ups

snippet: Nokia and AT&T have aggressively promoted the new Lumia 900 smartphone with a big marketing campaign, but at Best Buy, Lumia sales still pale in comparison to the hottest Android phones, an executive there says.
abstract: Nokia and AT&T have aggressively promoted the new Lumia 900 smartphone with a big marketing campaign, but at Best Buy, Lumia sales still pale in comparison to the hottest Android phones, an executive there says.

headline.main: At Best Buy, Lumia Is Selling O.K. but More Slowly Than Android

snippet: As Nokia waits for its high-end business to grow, it made another move to shore up its bread-and-butter market. The company on Wednesday added two touch-screen cellphones to its low-end lineup. The Finnish company generates about 54 percent of its...
abstract: As Nokia waits for its high-end business to grow, it made another move to shore up its bread-and-butter market. The company on Wednesday added two touch-screen cellphones to its low-end lineup. The Finnish company generates about 54 percent of its revenue from so-called bulk models.

headline.main: Nokia Adds to Its Low-End Lineup of Phones

snippet: Apple is expected to dump Google Maps from its operating system in favor of its own product. Google said it costs a lot more for quality mapping than Apple understands.
abstract: Apple is expected to dump Google Maps from its operating system in favor of its own product. Google said it costs a lot more for quality mapping than Apple understands.

snippet: If you are walking alone and in a potentially dangerous situation, an app called StreetSafe can connect you to a safety adviser who can track your location and call 911 if necessary.
abstract: If you are walking alone and in a potentially dangerous situation, an app called StreetSafe can connect you to a safety adviser who can track your location and call 911 if necessary.

headline.main: AppSmart Extra: Someone to Watch Over Me
headline.print_headline: An App Offers Someone to Watch Over You
